thread.title: Division series start times through Sunday announced
thread.title_full: Division series start times through Sunday announced - KCTV5

author: Chris Oberholtz, Multimedia Producer
title: Division series start times through Sunday announced
text:
KANSAS CITY, MO (KCTV) - Major League Baseball has announced the start times for division series games through Sunday.
The AL East Champion Toronto Blue Jays will host the AL West Champion Texas Rangers in Game 1 of the AL Division Series at Rogers Centre on Thursday at either 2:37 p.m. or 3:07 p.m. depending on the winner of the AL Wild Card Game. 
Later that evening, at either 6:37 p.m. or 7:07 p.m., the AL Central Champion Kansas City Royals will host the winner of the AL Wild Card Game -either the Houston Astros or the New York Yankees in Game 1 of the ALDS at Kauffman Stadium. 
On Friday, the start times of the full slate of four division series games will be 11:45 p.m. (TEX @ TOR, Game 2); 2:45 p.m. (AL Wild Card Game winner @ KC); 5:45 p.m. (NL Wild Card Game winner @ STL); and 8:45 p.m. (NYM @ LAD). 
The first of Saturday’s pair of contests – each an NLDS Game 2 – will get underway at 4:37 p.m. in St. Louis, where the Cardinals will host the NL Wild Card Game winner. 
The Dodgers will then host the Mets with a 8:07 p.m. start. 
The first of Sunday’s pair of contests – each an ALDS Game 3 – will begin at 3:10 p.m., featuring the Royals at either Houston or New York.  The Rangers will then host the Blue Jays at 7:10 p.m.
